definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: The stress falls on the second syllable.

sentences.chinese: 其它的音節都是非重音。

sentences.english: Being able to say simple sentences in correct stresses and intonations.
sentences.chinese: 能以正確的重音及語調說出簡單的句子。

sentences.english: What would be stressed in that phrase, "I see"?
sentences.chinese: 在“我看到“這個詞裏重音應該是什麼？“

sentences.english: The phonological structure of English is a dynamic system in the light of stress.
sentences.chinese: 英語音系結構是一個重音觀照下的動態系統。

sentences.english: Accent is something somewhat difficult to define and categorize.
sentences.chinese: 重音是很難定義和分辨的。

sentences.english: This can avoid breaking the glass products due to thermal stress.
sentences.chinese: 這可能避免打破玻璃產品由於熱量重音。

sentences.english: The accent falls on the third syllable.
sentences.chinese: 重音落在第三個音節上。

sentences.english: But for complex bugs, the accent will be on the "random".
sentences.chinese: 然而對於複雜的錯誤，重音則轉向“隨機”。

sentences.english: The songs and even the bow of the practice, should no longer occur when the next bow accent.
sentences.chinese: 音小連弓的練習，不應再下弓時出現重音。

sentences.english: Stress is not predictable by rule and must be learned word by word.
sentences.chinese: 重音不可按規則預測，必須逐詞學習。

sentences.english: The main suprasegmental features include stress, tone and intonation.
sentences.chinese: 主要的超切分特徵包括重音，語調和聲調。

sentences.english: Most two-syllable words in English are stressed on the first syllable.
sentences.chinese: 英語中的很多雙音節單詞的重音都是在第一個音節。

sentences.english: Accentuate the word “accent”on the first syllable.
sentences.chinese: 在“accent”一詞的第一個音節上加重音符號。

sentences.english: Phonological presupposition trigger is mainly the contrastive stress, belonging to dynamic sentence.
sentences.chinese: 音系類預設觸發語屬於動態句子，主要是對比重音。

definition: pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
final sound of a syllable/rhyme (e.g. in European languages)
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
